DOC.brief_summary: The investigators retrospectively evaluated the efficacy of granulocyte transfusions as adjunctive treatment for severe infections in neutropenic fever unresponsive to antimicrobial therapy in hematological patients.
DOC.brief_title: Granulocyte Transfusions in Hematological Patients With Febrile Neutropenia
DOC.criteria: fever; presence of absolute neutrophil count <0.5 x 10^9/L evidence of bacterial or fungal infections (including clinical signs of infection, positive cultures or biopsy, and radiological evidences) unresponsiveness to appropriate antimicrobial therapy for at least 48 hours
